name: Arnoldâ€“Givental conjecture
rephrased: A Hamiltonian diffeomorphism on a closed symplectic manifold must have at least as many fixed points as the minimum number of critical points a smooth function on that same manifold can have.
implication_form: If a Hamiltonian diffeomorphism exists on a closed symplectic manifold, then it must have at least the minimal number of critical points of a smooth function on that manifold.
